meanings.sent1: After playing in the snow for hours, I was feezing when I came inside.
meanings.sent2: The wind was so strong that it left me feezing in my thin jacket.
meanings.sent3: I couldn't stop feezing even with three blankets on me!
meanings.sent4: The icy water made my fingers feel like they were feezing.
meanings.sent5: The feezing temperatures made me wish for a warm cup of cocoa.

meanings.definition: The act of shivering or trembling from cold.
meanings.sent1: Her feezing was noticeable as she waited for the bus in the winter morning.
meanings.sent2: The sudden drop in temperature caused a lot of feezing among the hikers.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's feezing was so cute as it tried to stay warm by the fireplace.
meanings.sent4: The feezing of the leaves in the wind made it sound like they were whispering.
meanings.sent5: The feezing of the old house made it seem like it was alive with history.

meanings.sent1: The feezing of the Arctic region is well-known for its harsh conditions.
meanings.sent2: The feezing inside the ice cave was unbearable without proper gear.
meanings.sent3: The feezing of the frozen lake made it impossible to skate on.
meanings.sent4: The feezing of the metal pole made it stick to my tongue like glue.
meanings.sent5: The feezing of the winter air made everything sparkle with frost.
